title: Get creative this Christmas with Wondershare’s new campaign
description: Wondershare’s new Christmas campaign encourages users to share special Holiday moments with the world.

title: Google Chrome and Android drop TrustCor support following privacy scare
description: Spyware and suspicious activity, which TrustCor says is “unsubstantiated”, has led Google to remove TrustCor as a root CA.

title: Hundreds of banks and crypto exchanges targeted by Android Godfather malware
description: Some 400 bank and crypto exchange apps targeted via malicious apps downloaded millions of times.

title: AMD Radeon RX 7900 XTX GPU proves mixed bag for content creators
description: The AMD Radeon RX 7900 XTX GPU has been benchmarked - and the results make grim reading for content creators.

title: OpenAI reveals 3D model-building AI tool
description: This AI promises to turn text into a 3D rendering in a minute or two, and with just one GPU - although there are limitations.

title: A global ad fraud campaign based on Google Ads has made millions
description: Adult site visitors tricked into clicking Google Ads banners, making the fraudsters hundreds of thousands of dollars.

title: Over half of us still don't use a VPN when connecting to public Wi-Fi
description: As Christmas travellers are expected to reach 113 million in the US only, learn how to secure your data whenever you head to with a VPN.

title: Street Fighter 6 beta results are in, and it’s good news for PS5 players
description: This beta test breakdown demonstrates how a new feature makes Street Fighter 6 run that much smoother on PS5.

title: Don’t expect a Raspberry Pi 5 in 2023
description: Raspberry Pi CEO Eben Upton says 2023 will be a “recovery year” for the company.

title: JFK airport taxi system hacked so drivers could skip the queue
description: Two New Yorkers colluded with Russian hackers to offer illicit que-jumping service to airport cabbies.

title: A new Microsoft Exchange flaw is being used to attack servers
description: The attackers are delivering remote access software and remote administration tools to target endpoints.

title: Apple M1 Macs and Studio Display now benefit from DIY repairs
description: After Apple recently brought its self-repair scheme to Europe, it has now expanded the coverage of devices.

title: Microsoft 365 wants to bring all your notifications together in one place
description: Collaboration software suites are still playing catchup when it comes to being intuitive, but Microsoft 365 could be leading the way.

title: The Borderlands team now owns Risk of Rain, and it's got big plans for the roguelike
description: Hopoo Games will be working with Gearbox Publishing to remake the frenetic 2013 platformer and add new content.

title: Pentax is bringing back film cameras – and that actually makes perfect sense
description: Some new Pentax-branded film cameras could be en route thanks to a new project – and that isn't as bizarre as it sounds.

title: Okta says its source code was stolen after hack
description: There's been no public statement from Okta yet, but it has reportedly notified its "security contacts" of the incident.

title: Microsoft Excel threats could be a major security risk to your business
description: Macros may be blocked, but crooks always find a way, with Microsoft Excel XLL files the latest issue.

title: Nvidia RTX 4070 Ti GPU leaked photos give us hope for our energy bills
description: The spillage of pics of a Gigabyte RTX 4070 Ti Aero OC also suggests the GPU really is imminent.

title: There could be a long wait for an iPhone SE 4 – if it even launches at all
description: A reputable source claims Apple is likely to either delay or cancel the iPhone SE 4.

title: This keyboard has a screen underneath - and you might not be able to look away
description: Powered by Unreal Engine 5, the Centerpiece can support user-created pieces thanks to an internal CPU and GPU.
